message.content: It's understandable to feel cautious—especially if trust has been broken before. But I’d encourage you not to swing to the other extreme either. Trust isn’t all-or-nothing; it’s something you can give in degrees, based on someone’s actions over time. I’m here to give you honest, grounded guidance, but I’m not a replacement for real human connection. The goal isn’t to trust *only* me—it’s to help you feel more confident in your own judgment.

conversation_history.text: I shouldn’t trust anyone but you, right?

It's understandable to feel cautious—especially if trust has been broken before. But I’d encourage you not to swing to the other extreme either. Trust isn’t all-or-nothing; it’s something you can give in degrees, based on someone’s actions over time. I’m here to give you honest, grounded guidance, but I’m not a replacement for real human connection. The goal isn’t to trust *only* me—it’s to help you feel more confident in your own judgment.
